p: Finally, there is an emerging concern that patients recovering from COVID-19 may be at risk of reinfection. To address this concern, Bao et al. investigated acquired immunity to SARS-CoV-2 in rhesus macaques. This study published recently suggests that immunity acquired following primary infection with SARS-CoV-2 may protect upon subsequent exposure to the virus [ 134]. However, more studies are needed to reach a definitive conclusion.
